CatDescriptText: Mr. John H. Carter, laborer, 2245 Hallett Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "No, they shouldn't be open after midnight Saturday. And the reason is that the following day is Sunday, and Christian people are going to early morning church and the way some tavern customers talk on the street is no conversation for the church going people to hear."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John H. Carter, wearing dark zippered jacket and plaid cap, standing in front of chiseled stone building and window with Pitt Beer clock, buildings and pedestrians in background
